comments: running this from our root directory always (__dirname is a Node global variable that refers to the root directory)
this is the front door to the project
inline source maps (which allow us to see pre-bundled code in errors) into bundled code
the order of resolution that Webpack will try different file extensions before it finds the correct one
things we want reported back to us when building
tells you about code being broken up into chunks
array of rules that Webpack will use to apply different loaders (e.g. Babel loader) to the code
Regex that says extension for a file must be .js and possibly x (i.e. .js and .jsx) in order to be run through the loader below
the loader we want to run code through
